byline.original: By KATHARINE Q. SEELYE and JERÉ LONGMAN

abstract: Boston 2024, private organization leading city's bid for Summer Olympic Games, faces significant challenge in shoring up public support ahead of 2017 selection of host city; group has put issue to referendum on 2016 ballot, failure of which would be enormous blow to backers and to the United States Olympic Committee; officials have pledged that games will be far more affordable than those in past, and would leave behind fewer 'white elephant' facilities.
lead_paragraph: If a referendum on continuing Boston’s candidacy for the 2024 Olympics fails, it will be a huge blow to its backers and another blow to the U.S.O.C.’s effort to bring back the Games.

headline.main: In Boston Olympic Bid Vote, More Is at Stake Than Games
headline.print_headline: In Vote on Boston Bid, U.S.O.C.’s Future Is at Stake, Too

snippet: If a referendum on continuing Boston’s candidacy for the 2024 Olympics fails, it will be a huge blow to its backers and another blow to the U.S.O.C.’s effort to bring back the Games.
